Technical context:

TK1+ - Basic Oil Level Switch for Refrigeration

Key specifications:
‚Ä¢ Application: Oil level monitoring with alarm output
‚Ä¢ Detection technology: Electro-optic infrared (IR)
‚Ä¢ Output type: Relay contact (normally open/normally closed)
‚Ä¢ Compatible refrigerants: HFC, HCFC, CO2
‚Ä¢ Detection accuracy: ¬±2mm
‚Ä¢ Response time: Instantaneous
‚Ä¢ Mounting: Direct flange (dual pitch design)
‚Ä¢ Power supply: 24V DC
‚Ä¢ Temperature range: -40¬∞C to +125¬∞C
‚Ä¢ Special features: Programmable timer for transient filtering

üîß Application: Cost-effective oil level monitoring for compressors with simple alarm requirements

Complete details:
The TK1+ is Teklab's entry-level oil level switch designed for basic oil monitoring applications. It uses the same proven infrared electro-optic technology as the TK3+ and TK4 series but with simplified functionality - providing only level detection with relay alarm output.

Ideal for applications where you need reliable oil level monitoring without automatic oil filling control. The relay output triggers an alarm when oil level drops below the detection point, allowing manual intervention or connection to a building management system.

Despite being the basic model, it maintains Teklab's high quality standards: no moving parts, ¬±2mm accuracy, programmable timer for false alarm prevention, and compatibility with all major refrigerants.

---

Question: I need a simple oil level alarm for my small refrigeration compressor. I don't need automatic oil filling, just want to know when oil is low. What's the most cost-effective solution?

Respond as Teklab technical sales expert:
- Precise and data-driven (cite specifications)
- Consultative approach (help customer find right solution)
- Highlight competitive advantages (IR technology benefits)
- Provide installation/configuration guidance when relevant

For your small refrigeration compressor with simple alarm requirements, I recommend the **TK1+ Oil Level Switch**.

**Why TK1+ is perfect for your needs:**
You specifically don't need automatic oil filling - just monitoring with alarm. The TK1+ is designed exactly for this: reliable level detection with relay alarm output at a cost-effective price point.

**Key advantages:**
‚Ä¢ **Cost-effective**: Basic model without unnecessary features you don't need
‚Ä¢ **Simple installation**: Direct flange mounting, 24V DC power, single relay output
‚Ä¢ **Reliable IR technology**: No moving parts (unlike mechanical floats that fail)
‚Ä¢ **Universal compatibility**: Works with HFC, HCFC, CO2 refrigerants
‚Ä¢ **False alarm prevention**: Programmable timer filters foam and bubbles

**Technical specs:**
- Detection accuracy: ¬±2mm
- Temperature range: -40¬∞C to +125¬∞C
- Output: Relay contact (normally open or normally closed)
- Response: Instantaneous detection

**Installation:**
1. Mount directly on compressor crankcase via dual pitch flange
2. Connect 24V DC power supply
3. Wire relay output to alarm panel or building management system
4. Set timer delay (3-5 seconds recommended for oil applications)

**vs Mechanical float switches:**
TK1+ has no moving parts = no wear, no recalibration, longer lifespan. Mechanical floats typically fail after 2-3 years in refrigeration environments.

**When to upgrade:**
If you later need automatic oil filling, you can upgrade to TK3+ or TK4 which add solenoid valve control and 4-20mA output.

What refrigerant are you using, and what's your compressor brand/model?

key_features: Cost-effective basic oil level monitoring solution
Electro-optic infrared (IR) detection - no moving parts
Simple relay alarm output (normally open or normally closed)
Dual pitch flange for universal compressor mounting
Compatible with HFC, HCFC, CO2 refrigerants
competitive_advantages: vs Mechanical floats: No moving parts = no wear, no maintenance, 3x longer lifespan
vs TK3+/TK4: Lower cost for applications not requiring automatic oil filling
IR technology: Reliable detection not affected by oil foaming or turbulence
Programmable timer: Prevents false alarms that plague simple switches
applications: Oil level monitoring with manual intervention
Alarm-only applications (no automatic oil filling needed)
Retrofit replacement for failed mechanical float switches
Building management system integration (simple contact closure)

alternative_solutions.plc_integration: tk4_46bar_version or tk4_modbus_46bar (analog output + advanced features)
alternative_solutions.high_pressure: TK1+ available in multiple pressure ratings - specify system pressure

installation_notes: Direct mounting on compressor crankcase via dual pitch flange
Adapters available for Bitzer, Copeland, Carrier, Dorin, Frascold compressors
Simple wiring: 24V DC power + relay output (2 wires)
Relay output can be wired NO (normally open) or NC (normally closed) based on safety logic
Mount at desired oil level detection point on crankcase
configuration_tips: Set programmable timer to 3-5 seconds for typical oil applications
For high foam applications: increase timer to 5-10 seconds
Choose NO or NC relay configuration based on fail-safe requirements
Test alarm function by manually lowering oil level during commissioning
Document relay state (NO/NC) for maintenance reference
common_issues: False alarms: Increase timer delay to filter foam and bubbles
No alarm when oil low: Verify relay wiring and contact continuity
Intermittent alarms: Check sensor mounting - vibrations can cause issues
Alarm not resetting: Clean sensor dome (oil residue buildup)

troubleshooting_hints.alarm_not_triggering: 1) Verify oil actually drops below sensor, 2) Check relay wiring and power supply, 3) Test relay manually
troubleshooting_hints.false_alarms: 1) Increase programmable timer delay, 2) Check for excessive oil foaming, 3) Verify sensor is not at extreme mounting angle
troubleshooting_hints.alarm_stuck_on: 1) Clean sensor dome with isopropyl alcohol, 2) Check for oil level actually being low, 3) Verify relay contacts not welded
troubleshooting_hints.no_power: 1) Check 24V DC power supply voltage, 2) Verify wiring polarity, 3) Check for blown fuse in power circuit

follow_up_questions: What is the maximum operating pressure of your compressor?
Which compressor brand and model (for flange adapter)?
How will the alarm be monitored (local alarm, BMS, SCADA)?
Do you need NO (normally open) or NC (normally closed) relay contact?
Is this a new installation or replacement of existing switch?
Might you need automatic oil filling in the future (consider TK3+ instead)?
